# The Campbell's Company (CPB) - Comprehensive Analysis Report

## 1. Company Overview

The Campbell's Company (CPB), together with its subsidiaries, manufactures and markets food and beverage products in the United States and internationally. The company was founded in 1869 and is headquartered in Camden, New Jersey. The company was formerly known as Campbell Soup Company and changed its name to The Campbell's Company in November 2024. It operates through Meals & Beverages, and Snacks segments. In fiscal 2025 (July year-end), snacks accounted for 43% of its revenue, followed by soup (27%), other simple meals (23%), and beverages (7%). Beyond its namesake, its brands include Pepperidge Farm, Goldfish, Snyder's of Hanover, Swanson, Pacific Foods, Prego, Pace, V8, and, most recently, Rao's (a deal that closed in 2024). Around 90% of its revenue results from the US and the remainder from Canada and Latin America.

## 3. Existing Products/Services

The Meals & Beverages segment provides Campbell's condensed and ready-to-serve soups; Swanson broth and stocks; Pacific Foods broth, soups, and non-dairy beverages; Prego pasta sauces; Pace Mexican sauces; Campbell's gravies, pasta, beans, and dinner sauces; Swanson canned poultry; V8 juices and beverages; Campbell's tomato juice; Rao's pasta sauces, dry pasta, frozen entrées, frozen pizza, and soups; and Michael Angelo's frozen entrées and pasta sauces. Its Snacks segment retails Pepperidge Farm cookies, crackers, fresh bakery, and frozen products, that includes Goldfish crackers, Snyder's of Hanover pretzels, Lance sandwich crackers, Cape Cod and Kettle Brand potato chips, Late July snacks, Snack Factory pretzel crisps, and other snacking products.

Today, the company is a North American focused brand powerhouse, generating fiscal 2025 net sales of $10.3 billion across two divisions: Meals & Beverages and Snacks. Campbell's portfolio of 16 leadership brands includes: Campbell's, Cape Cod, Chunky, Goldfish, Kettle Brand, Lance, Late July, Pace, Pacific Foods, Pepperidge Farm, Prego, Rao's, Snack Factory pretzel crisps, Snyder's of Hanover, Swanson and V8.

## 4. Planned Products/Services/Projects

The Campbell's Company is buying a 49% stake in La Regina, the maker of Rao's pasta sauce, with the option to buy the rest of the Italian food manufacturer. Campbell's said the transaction, which will be paid in two tranches, will better position the CPG giant to continue growing the brand by ensuring quality, accelerating innovation and product development. Rao's has branched out into pasta, frozen entrees, pizza and soups. In fiscal 2025, Campbell's 16 leadership brands represented about 90% of total net sales, with meals and beverages gaining 0.2 share points and delivering 1% dollar consumption growth, offsetting softness in snacks. Rao's brand net sales rose at a high single-digit rate on a pro forma basis, and recent innovation contributed approximately 3% to consolidated net sales, led by Milano White Chocolate and health-forward broth offerings.

## 5. Growth Strategy

"Our stronghold in the Italian sauce category continues as Rao's, which will soon become our fourth billion-dollar brand, and Prego hold the top two spots in dollar share, and we are excited about the prospects for future growth with these great brands." Rao's is a key part of Campbell's efforts to accelerate growth and increase its exposure to premium products. For one, the portfolio mix has shifted significantly: its core soup lineup now accounts for just over 25% of total sales (down from more than 40% in fiscal 2017), while snacks account for just over 40% (up from less than 30%). In addition, the firm has worked to drive efficiencies across its supply chain and manufacturing network to boost spending behind its brands and capabilities, thereby solidifying its competitive edge.

The company's transformation efforts and cost savings initiatives provide some downside protection, but execution risks and persistent macro headwinds make this a cautious hold rather than a compelling growth opportunity for investors seeking strong upside potential.

The Campbell's Company (CPB) is a North American food and beverage manufacturer with a portfolio of 16 leadership brands spanning meals, beverages, and snacks, including Campbell's, Goldfish, Rao's, and Pepperidge Farm. 

Campbell's is strategically pivoting from traditional soup products to premium categories, with a notable focus on the Rao's brand acquisition and expanding its Italian food offerings. The company has been aggressively pursuing cost savings (targeting $375 million by 2028) while managing challenges like tariff impacts and margin compression. Key strengths include market leadership in Italian sauces and a diversified product mix, with snacks now representing 43% of revenue. Recent developments include purchasing a 49% stake in La Regina and continuing to innovate across product lines.

With an AI buy rating of 4.5/10, the stock is considered a cautious hold, marginally undervalued at $26 with a fair value estimate of $30-32, reflecting modest growth potential amid structural market challenges.
